Yes, Congratulations, Barbara!

How does one purchase it?  :)

Kalli

On 1/4/07, secretary <secretarytocapt3@...> wrote:
>
>   Historically, the first work of fiction to be published in English
> was:
>
> Dai-bosatsu Toge printed in 1929
> http://www.shinsengumihq.com/DBT.htm
>
> and now we have...
> MIRROR MIRROR
> http://www.shinsengumihq.com/MirrorMirror.htm
> which was written by Barbara Sheridan who for many years has
> supported Shinsengumihq.com financially and oversaw this list with
> her awesome omnipotence and wisdom
>
> I would like to congratulate her on this historical mark in Western
> Shinsengumi fandom (^_^)
>
> We will post news on MIrror Mirror here on the mailing list and on
> http://www.shinsengumihq.com
> I hope that we fans will help make this work a major success
>
> ---------------------------
> X-posted from
> originally written by Anne Cain
> http://groups.yahoo.com/group/dragonsdisciple/message/482
> http://www.dragonsdisciple.com
> ---------------------------
> Barb has just been offered a contract for her YA novel "Mirror,
> Mirror" from Mardi Gras Publishing!
> http://www.mardigraspublishing.com/ This is my personal fave of Barb's
> stories, and it features guest appearances by the SHINSENGUMI! The
> book will be coming out in ebook form, and in print!
>
> Making this already awesome news even cooler, her daughter will doing
> the cover art! In fact, Barb's daughter has been contracted by MGP as
> a cover artist!! (And she's only 16...*DIES*) Just check out some of
> this girl's work:
> http://s114.photobucket.com/albums/n269/b_sheridan/Victoria_Sousou/
>
> *SQUEEEE*!!
>
> ~Anne
>
> MIRROR, MIRROR
> by Barbara Sheridan
>
> Emiko "Emmi" Maeda didn't plan to spend the last summer vacation
> before college kidnaping the future Emperor of Japan. And she didn't
> expect to be chased, attacked, or seduced by sword wielding samurai or
> put on the marriage market by an ancestor who died a century before
> she was born, but she was. And it all started with a shabby old mirror
> she found after publicly humiliating herself...
>
>
